page.title: 12FARMING,Shortacombe,Yeoford.
page.content: In the half term week some of the children from the school went to {Shortacombe Farm}and saw the cows being milked we got to the farm at about 5.45 a.m.They have 64 cows and we saw 57 being milked. In the parlour it will take 8 cows but they milk 4 at a time. If a cow kicked there was a steel bar to put on its back to stop it. Before the cows are milked their udders are washed. The milk goes to {North Tawton}cheese factory. Then we took the cows up the road and we put them in a field. All the milk went into a big cooler which kept the milk cool until the tanker came to take the milk away. There was a tube on the back of the milk tanker then the tube was fixed on to the tanker and it took the milk out of the cooler we stood on a stool to see the milk all go into the cooler. There was 222 gallons.
